reference_summary:
Luther 3
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Emmy Central, Emmy Nominees
['Luther 3', 'Idris Elba (The Wire) won a Golden Globe for his depiction of John Luther in this gripping, smart, and riveting psychological thriller from the BBC. In this new mini-series, a twisted fetishist is targeting young women in London. As Luther is called to another case, will the killer escape his grips? Luther faces an even bigger threat as members of his own team will stop at nothing to bring him down. And as a vigilante killer takes justice into his own hands, Luther questions his own sense of morality. Can he continue to walk the thin line between right and wrong, or has he finally met his match?', ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '27576722', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours', 'Release date': 'September 10, 2013', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'}
I loved seasons one and two and could not wait to watch season three. After having done so and recovered from the shock, I can honestly say I don't understand what the creators were thinking in having the characters make the choices they made. And the women, this season, were just two-dimensional victims for the most part. I'd probably re-watch seasons one and two but, sadly, not this one.
i liked the previous two seasons better
Dorfman in Love
Comedy, Passionate, Sweet, Ambitious
["When Deb Dorfman volunteers to cat sit at her unrequited love's new downtown LA loft, her world changes forever.  Over seven days, she embarks on a journey of self-discovery that leads her to find her true love."]
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brad Leong'], 'Producers': ['Leonard Hill'], 'Starring': ['Sara Rue', 'Elliott Gould', 'Haaz Sleiman']}
cute movie. different enough from the standard formula to keep me watching.
some surprising choices
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ryan Kwanten', 'Sara Canning'], 'Producers': ['Stephen Alix', 'Paula Devonshire', 'Tara Finegan', 'Michael Frislev', 'Ari Lantos', 'Robert Lantos', 'Ben Murray', 'Mark Musselman', 'Chad Oakes'], 'Starring': ['Ryan Kwanten', 'Kristen Hager', 'Maria Menounos']}
as you can see from the other reviews, some people liked this; others didn't. this kept me from watching this movie for quite a while but i'm glad i eventually did. at first i couldn't decide whether or not i liked this movie but in the end i decided it was different enough from other rom-coms to be enjoyable. it was worth watching. the acting was great. the male lead seemed familiar and i recognized the bride's mother, of course, but i did not know any of the other actors. apparently, they have experience. i was pleasantly surprised.
glad I watched

Different

character driven
Grantchester
Suspense, Drama
['In GRANTCHESTER, a young vicar and a veteran cop join forces to solve baffling murders around a placid English village in 1953.']
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Harry Bradbeer', 'Tim Fywell', 'Jim Robertson'], 'Producers': ['Diederick Santer'], 'Starring': ['James Norton', 'Robson Green', 'Morven Christie']}
Once you get to know the town and its characters, it is hard to walk away. Great writing. I don't watch this for the mystery but for everything else.
Lovely way to spend a rainy afternoon.

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to favor dramatic television series, particularly psychological thrillers, and comedic narratives with unique perspectives. They have shown an increasing appreciation for films featuring quirky characters and strong on-screen chemistry.

- **Favorite Themes:** The user maintains a firm interest in complex character arcs, moral dilemmas, and strong female roles, prioritizing themes of personal growth and connection. Their focus on high-quality writing and character development remains evident, seeking out nuanced storytelling that transcends conventional genres.

- **Previous Engagement:** Their ratings consistently reflect an appreciation for character progression and continuity, alongside thoughtful and innovative storytelling. They especially value performances that enhance the viewing experience through compelling interactions.

- **Critical Engagement:** The reviews indicate a discerning approach, emphasizing character depth and meaningful choices, while recognizing the value of well-executed ensemble casts that add richness to narratives.

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user holds a generally positive outlook toward older works, while remaining cautious of later installments that may lack quality. Their love for intellectually engaging humor and depth in storytelling is evident.

- **Viewing Habits:** The user enjoys re-watching beloved series and films that immerse them in the intricacies of relationships and community dynamics, valuing character interactions and chemistry, even amidst suspense or mystery elements.
